title: How to Connect a Logitech Wireless Keyboard to Any Device

steps.title: Turn the keyboard on.
steps.content: Turn the keyboard on. Each keyboard will be slightly different, but there should be an on switch along the top edge of your keyboard to switch it on.

steps.title: Ensure one of the Easy-Switch buttons is flashing repeatedly.
steps.content: Ensure one of the Easy-Switch buttons is flashing repeatedly. It will likely be the Easy-Switch button with a 1 on it. This means the keyboard is in pairing mode. The Easy-Switch button has an icon that looks like a computer monitor, a tablet, and a phone. If the Easy-Switch button isn't blinking rapidly, press and hold it for 3 seconds. If your keyboard doesn't have an Easy-Switch button, press the pc button for Windows, Linux, and Chrome OS computers, and the i button for macOS computers.

steps.title: Open the Bluetooth pairing menu on your computer.
steps.content: Open the Bluetooth pairing menu on your computer. If you're not sure how to do this, try the following: On Windows, click the Windows icon and go to Settings > Devices > Bluetooth & other devices , then toggle Bluetooth on. On Mac, click on the Apple menu, then go to Settings > Bluetooth , then turn Bluetooth on.

steps.title: Choose your keyboard from the list of available Bluetooth devices.
steps.content: Choose your keyboard from the list of available Bluetooth devices. The device name will be the same as the keyboard's model name.

steps.title: Type the code shown on the screen.
steps.content: Type the code shown on the screen. You will be prompted to enter a 6-digit code on your keyboard. Type it in, then press Enter .

steps.title: Click Connect.
steps.content: Click Connect . Your keyboard is now connected to your computer via Bluetooth. [1] X Research source

steps.content: Turn the keyboard on. Each keyboard will be slightly different, but there should be an on switch along the top edge of your keyboard to switch it on.

steps.title: Plug the wireless receiver into one of the USB ports on your computer.
steps.content: Plug the wireless receiver into one of the USB ports on your computer. If you can't find the wireless receiver, look under the battery cover. The receiver is usually stored here when it's not in use. As soon as you plug in the receiver, your keyboard will be connected, but it may take a moment to install any drivers for the keyboard.

steps.title: Optimize the keyboard for your operating system.
steps.content: Optimize the keyboard for your operating system. To do this, press Fn + O for macOS or Fn + P for Windows, Linux, and Chrome OS. [2] X Research source

steps.title: My Logitech keyboard isn't connecting.
steps.content: My Logitech keyboard isn't connecting. If your keyboard won't connect, you can try one of these quick troubleshooting steps: Restart the keyboard (by using the switch on the keyboard to turn it off, then on) Change the keyboard's battery Try a different USB port (if using a wireless receiver) Update your Bluetooth drivers If nothing else works, you may need to contact Logitech for one-on-one assistance.
